question: 61. Which of the following are the ways you should consider using Multipart Upload?
options: B. For uploading large objects to reduce the cost of ingress related to those objects
C. For uploading any size files over a spotty network to increase resiliency
D. For uploading files that must be appended to existing files
A. For uploading large objects over a stable high-bandwidth network to maximize bandwidth
answers: C. For uploading any size files over a spotty network to increase resiliency
A. For uploading large objects over a stable high-bandwidth network to maximize bandwidth

question: 62. How is a presigned URL different from a normal URL? (Choose two.)
options: C. A presigned URL allows access to private S3 buckets without requiring AWS credentials.
A. A presigned URL has permissions associated with certain objects provided by the creator of the URL.
B. A presigned URL has permissions associated with certain objects provided by the user of the URL.
D. A presigned URL includes encrypted credentials as part of the URL.
answers: C. A presigned URL allows access to private S3 buckets without requiring AWS credentials.
A. A presigned URL has permissions associated with certain objects provided by the creator of the URL.

question: 63. Which of the following can be put behind a presigned URL?
options: B. An EC2 instance with a web interface

question: 64. How long is a presigned URL valid?
options: D. As long as it is configured to last
answers: D. As long as it is configured to last

question: 65. Which of the following HTTP methods with regard to S3 have eventual consistency? (Choose two.)
66. Which of the following behaviors is consistent with how S3 handles object operations on a bucket?
options: A. A process writes a new object to Amazon S3 and immediately lists keys within its bucket. The new object does not appear in the list of keys.
C. A process deletes an object and immediately lists the keys in the bucket. S3 returns a list with the deleted object in the list.
B. A process deletes an object, attempts to immediately read the deleted object, and S3 still returns the deleted data.

question: 67. In which regions does Amazon S3 offer eventual consistency for overwrite PUTs and DELETEs?
options: D. No regions, eventual consistency is not the model for overwrite PUTs.
B. All US and EU regions

69. EBS stands for what?
70. What is the consistency model in S3 for PUTs of new objects?
71. How many PUTs per second does S3 support?
72. You have been asked to create a new S3 bucket with the name prototypeBucket32 in the US West region. What would the URL for this bucket be?
73. What unique domain name do S3 buckets created in US East (N. Virginia) have, as compared to other regions?
74. Which of the following are valid domain names for S3 buckets? (Choose two.)
75. What are the two styles of URLs that AWS supports for S3 bucket access? (Choose two.)
76. Which of the following are valid URLs for accessing S3 buckets? (Choose two.)
77. What is an AWS storage gateway?
options: C. A device to facilitate large data migrations into S3
D. A device that can be used to cache S3-stored objects at an on-premises site
B. A device that enables an on-premises site to upload files to S3 faster than over the public Internet
A. A device to reside at a customer site that is part of a VPN connection between an onpremises site and AWS
answers: D. A device that can be used to cache S3-stored objects at an on-premises site

question: 78. Which of the following statements is not true about an AWS storage gateway?
options: B. It is available as both a physical and virtual appliance.
C. It caches data locally at a customer site.
D. It interacts with S3 buckets.
A. It is a virtual appliance.
answers: B. It is available as both a physical and virtual appliance.

question: 79. Which of the following are not true about S3? (Choose two.)
options: B. Bucket names exist in a per-region namespace.
A. Buckets are created in specific regions.
D. Each S3 bucket stores up to 5 TB of object data.
answers: B. Bucket names exist in a per-region namespace.
D. Each S3 bucket stores up to 5 TB of object data.

question: 80. Which of the following consistency models are supported by S3? (Choose two.)
